p: At first glance, oleogum resins of B. papyrifera resemble those of B. sacra with regard to the contents of acetylated boswellic acids [ 5] and of α-pinene ( Table 4). However, a closer look at the contents of KBAs and especially AKBAs reveals that B. dalzielli is unique ( Figure 6c). The total AKBAs content (53.4–72.2 µg/mg) is significantly higher compared to all other species ( p < 0.01, one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) post hoc Fisher´s least significant difference (LSD), whereby the proportion of α-AKBA is higher too compared to B. sacra. Furthermore, the total KBAs content (9.8–13.8 µg/mg) is higher than in most other Boswellia species.
